data.message: Facebook is being Patriotic for a change?

replies.message: Hi Kevin. At Facebook, we believe in the value and impact of service members, Veterans, and their families. On Veterans Day, we would like to especially take the time to thank and honor the service of this community! -Pri
I've never thought of Facebook as being described by any kind of positive adjective. This is no exception.
Right!
Facebook don’t be afraid to post Old Glory 🇺🇸
Sssssuuuuurrrreeee you do facebook...
Happy Veterans Day! Thank you Facebook
Your Work For Fuak.

America (U.S. that is) is definitely one of a kind!!, ...the ONLY - PERHAPS -  War that was acknowledged by the world, as totally useless, and political-purposed only, WAS the Vietnam War. Millions of Americans Do Think the same, that is - IT IS ONLY TO BE ASHAMED OF...!!!... yet... those vets stay here, in HI (homeless sent to Honolulu by the cities of N.Y., Chicago, S.-Fr., and multiple others) showing their cardboard into windshield at traffic lights; all of them still repeating the mantra, " I 'm proud of that" (THAT refers for many to the short(est) time in their life, when it meant something for them... -Defending (???.. from what!!!...)) THE COUNTRY... Beyond that, and the Orange... - what did they have..?
lots of all walks of life-people understand what's The Shift Times Is.... Many of them ARE HERE, in U.S. Ideology can take away billions of minds. But new keep coming to Earth
Happy FB -weekend, everybody!

I call BS to FB comment on here !!
If Facebook truly felt that way, then they would limit anyones right to Free Speech when it comes to posts of a political view that is different than facebook !!
I see it happen all the time of posts being taken down that were simple politcial rants on ones own personal page simply because they align with one if the major parties !!!
*wouldnt
I believe in all the veterans that service for us that we come home to there family's en or waiting to hear then they come home I'm to waiting to no th

Facebook : Yet, Facebook is locking out military members and police officers too, asking for ID for name verification, then won't let them back again, ever. What a shame. :(
Facebook Thanks so much..God Bless u & God Bless The U*S*A*🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸

Thank you for all our veterans

Nagy Tamás ????????Ive never been asked for my military ID.  The only time anyone would be asked to prove they were or are military is when there is doubt of their service.  A group called Stolen Valor, goes after people claiming to be veteran’s.  Claiming they saw combat, blah, blah.  When in fact they’ve never served.
I’ve ran into several of them on FaceBook.  They’re not hard to pick out.

Sharon Larson : NOT military ID, any ID. Check out the complaints all over the Internet, not only civilians, but military members and police officers are also complaining about this. 1 person is report you falsely for "using a fake name", they immediately lock your account and ask for ID and other documents to prove your identity. Then they MAY unlock your account, but maybe not.
I'm not in the military but here is what happened: Facebook locked me out in April, I told them I have a harasser. They did unlock my account in 24 hours. 1 month later they locked me out for good. From may to this day, my main account is locked. 3 weeks ago I gave up and started keep sending them my ID card and other docs, they won't check it. Over 3 weeks now, I'm locked. There are many people Facebook don't answer and unlock, ever. Many of them are military and police. I just read like 2000 complaints on multiple websites, it's shocking. Civilians, military, police, Facebook ignores everyone. :-( 
(PS: This is my 3rd secondary account, since I can't use the main account I had for 5 or so years. FB won't unlock that one, but keeps turning off my secondary accounts. Unfair on every level.)
We thank you
